Package com.tversity.airflinger.sdk.android

Classes that provide the main functionality of the SDK, allowing "Flinging" of media to target devices.

Interface Summary
IWebViewMediaDelegate  
Types.IBrowseChildrenCallback This interface defines a callback function for browse server command
Types.ICommandCallback Provides an interface to receive a callback after an asynchronous command was performed.
Types.IEventCallback This interface defines callback functions that receive status change notifications.
Types.ILogCallback This interface defines a callback function to SDK logging
Types.IPositionEventCallback This interface defines callback functions for position information events
Types.IPositionInfoCallback Provides an interface to receive a callback after an asynchronous call to get player position info
Types.IVolumeLevelCallback This interface defines a callback function for get volume level command

Enum Summary
Types.CommandResult Defines the possible result values of commands sent to devices.
Types.DeviceStatus Defines the possible statuses a device can have.
Types.DeviceType Defines the possible types of devices.
 

Exception Summary
Types.AirFlingerException Parent class of all SDK exceptions
Types.CommandCancelledException Indicates that the AirFlinger SDK is shutting down before the command was processed
Types.CommandFailedException Indicates that the command sent to the device has failed
Types.DeviceOfflineException Indicates that the device you were trying to access is offline
Types.InitializationException Indicates that the AirFlinger SDK failed to initialize.
Types.InvalidBufferException Indicates that the AirFlinger SDK service operation could not complete.
Types.InvalidCommandException Indicates that the device does not support the requested command
Types.InvalidDeviceException Indicates that no device is known with the id specified
Types.InvalidParamException Indicates that an invalid parameter was sent
Types.OutOfBoundsException Indicates that the AirFlinger SDK service operation caused deviation from allowed bounds
Types.ServiceDisconnectedException Indicates that the AirFlinger SDK service has disconnected from the application
Types.SuccessException Indicates that an operation was completed successfully
Types.UnknownErrorException Indicates that an unknown error occurred
 

Package com.tversity.airflinger.sdk.android Description

Classes that provide the main functionality of the SDK, allowing "Flinging" of media to target devices.

The main class is AirFlinger. It should never be instantiated directly. Instead call AirFlinger.get() to get the single instance of this class.

AirFlinger.init() should be called before starting to use AirFlinger.
AirFlinger.terminate() should be called during shutdown for cleanup.

All methods are thread safe and can be called from any thread.
Some methods require the user to provide a callback.Those methods require communicating with devices on the network and are therefore asynchronous by nature.
Regardless of the thread that an AirFlinger method was called in, AirFlinger callbacks are always returned in the GUI thread.
It is therefore safe to access the GUI from within the callbacks.
Important: Any access to data that other threads access must be synchronized by the SDK user and is out of scope of AirFlinger.
